section.title: Tutorial 2: Navigating object details pages
section.para: For every object in the FlyMine database there is an object details page which provides all the fields, references and collections for that object along with additional information such as the GBrowse genome viewer for sequence features (see the User Manual for an explanation of these concepts). All object details pages have the same basic structure. Object details pages can be accessed using the Quick Search on the FlyMine homepage, or from result tables by clicking on the links, where available.

This tutorial will guide you through the structure of the object details pages and how to navigate them. The object details page for the zen gene will be used as an example. Enter the gene symbol zen into the Quick Search box on the FlyMine home page (See Tutorial 1 for more information). The query returns just one result so you are taken directly to the object details page for the zen gene.

The top left shows summary information for this gene - identifier, name and chromosome coordinates. Use the '+' boxes next to 'proteins', 'synonyms', etc. to open inline tables with more details. The 'FASTA' buttons retrieve sequences for any feature they appear next to.

listitem.para: A link to the gene report of the relevant model organism database.
A GBrowse image for the area surrounding this gene. Clicking on the image takes you to the GBrowse genome viewer.

section.para: Scroll down the page to see 'Other details by aspect'. This section has more detailed information about this gene divided into 'aspects'. The aspects correspond to categories of data shown on the FlyMine home page. Look at the Genomics aspect:

listitem.para: Entries in green show fields directly related to this gene. Use '+' boxes to open summary tables. For example, opening 'UTRs' will summarise 5' and 3' UTR information.
Entries in black text allow you to see the results of predefined queries run for this gene ('templates' See Tutorial 3). Those shown in light grey did not return any results.
'[details...]' links take you to object details pages for related database entries.

section.para: Scroll back up to the top of the page and click the '[details...]' link next to 'proteins'. This page presents more information about the 'ZEN_DROME' protein. The trail at the top keeps track of [details...] links you have followed.
